intro: Tarenna lifouana, commonly known as the New Caledonia tarenna, is a flowering plant native to the island of Lifou in New Caledonia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and clusters of small, white or pale yellow flowers. It typically grows in humid, shaded environments within the rainforest understory. Tarenna lifouana is of interest to botanists due to its restricted distribution and unique ecological adaptations.
